intro: Warrea bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia warrea, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, preferring well-drained soils. Warrea bahiensis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various growing conditions.
